Articles.Content:
@OtherBarry, yup, you're right. :/ As a workaround, you can download the manifest separately, and then, from the command-line, specify the path to the manifest as an argument to the script, e.g.:

real-solar-system.bat c:\path\to\real-solar-system.manifest

You'll want to redownload the manifest periodically, to get the latest version.

Could not find "java".

EDIT: That appears when i launch the bundler.

Edited March 29, 2014 by O Nerd

Phenom Anon X wrote a great post about getting Java set up on your machine. You might want to give it a read, and see if it helps you:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67668-Mod-bundler-for-Real-Solar-System-%282014-03-25%29?p=977803&viewfull=1#post977803
It worked! Thaks jamis!

Holy cow I tried out your earth and it takes a LOT of delta v to get into a 100km orbit. Which makes sense cause that's at the edge of the atmosphere. But how should I take my gravity turn with it?

Lastnight I managed to get my first Kerbalnaught into orbit in my carreer mode with the realistic techtree progression. I am only in basic rocketry but I managed to get Al Kerman into orbit. This was after a total of 12 unmanned launches, and 9 of those were failures on one level or another. Finally I had a rocket design that was consistant enough to attempt to launch a Kerbal. So one of my 9 "right stuff" kerbals was chosen. The next in the flight list was Al Kerman who is the 4th one on the roster, but due to extensive launch tests, and flight testing and drop testing of the pod and its safety systems Al was next in the line for flight.

I think it is funny because I still don't have EVA suites or any real life support system outside of the pod.

My next goal is to actually bring the capsule back down where I can get to it easier than the south pacific.

Nevermind. (10 chars)

Edited April 2, 2014 by Oksbad

I love to have problems with this! xD

oops:Errno::ENOENT (No such file or directory - build/GameData/Kethane/Grid.cfg)

done
active texture management has a 404 error for me, both basic and aggressive, if I find more mods that do this, i'll let you know
Did the 0.23.5 update break anything important? Despite my efforts I was unable to keep the game from updating to the new version =/.
I don't believe it has, other than MJ which Sarbian has already released a fix for.

active texture management has a 404 error for me, both basic and aggressive, if I find more mods that do this, i'll let you know

I am getting the same issue as well. In order to try and fix it, I downloaded the .manifest file from the first post (real-solar-system.manifest) and tried to alter the URL to the Active Texture Management mod, however, even when trying to load the original downloaded real-solar-system.manifest file without any modifications, Java gives an error.
I tried to update the manifest file, but now when I try to use that file, java spits out this mess... I checked on line 138, and there is no \t on it.
I cant seem to get it to work at all even after uncecking the ones it says gives me problems I get hug up on a toolbar error... and I have that unchecked
I tried this, and when I put the command into my command prompt it said, "C:\Users\username is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file"
nvm I fixed it THANK YOU!
Hm. KSP gets stuck when loading AIES and/or KW-R.

I'm getting the following error when I attempt to run this:

Fixed! Turns out I had to manually create the folder C:\tmp -- not sure if this scario is fixable directly in the code, but manually creating the folder is a usable workaround.

Darn, I am getting a "oops: OpenURI::HTTPError (404 Not Found)" error on "downloading Toolbar 1.7.0" (this is the RSS Pre6 .manifest file loaded via the file menu in the UI).

What's the best way around this?

Edit: Looks like I also get this error with Active Texture Management (Aggressive)...

Edit 2: See below -- out of date links fixed up by hand in the .manifest file seems to solve the issue.

Edited April 6, 2014 by jrandom
Thats the same problem I am haveing. though not with RSS pre 6

Thats the same problem I am haveing. though not with RSS pre 6

I've been editing the .manifest by hand -- the failing ones have out-of-date links. Looks like some of these mods, when updated, have the old verison removed. Fix up the download link in the .manifest file and the error goes away. (At least, so far it has... it's still downloading stuff at the moment.)
if the fix works mind shareing it with me I am not the best at programing

I've been editing the .manifest by hand

Where the manifest is?

Try this one. It's for RSS 6 Pre1 -- I just updated the broken download links, so some of the version numbers in the UI will not be technically correct. The downloads should work (at least for the ones I've checked for download).

The .manifest file is simply a text file so you can edit it with Notepad or whatever.

Where the manifest is?

I don't know where the default one is. I just downloaded the RSS 6Pre1 one from the top post in this forum and used the File menu in the bundler's UI to select it.
Where do I put it?
